titlStmt.titl: Canadian Community Health Survey, 2010: Annual Component
titlStmt.parTitl: Enquête sur la santé dans les collectivités canadiennes (ESCC) - Composante annuelle

AuthEnty.affiliation: Map and Data Library. University of Toronto

prodStmt.prodPlac: Carleton University Data Centre, Ottawa, Ontario, Canada Toronto, Ontario: Map & Data Library, University of Toronto

serStmt.serInfo:
The Canadian Community Health Survey (CCHS) is a cross-sectional survey that collects information related to health status, health care utilization and health determinants for the Canadian population. The survey's objectives were to:
• support health surveillance programs by providing health data at the national, provincial and intra-provincial levels;
• provide a single data source for health research on small populations and rare characteristics;
• timely release of information easily accessible to a diverse community of users; and
• create a flexible survey instrument that includes a rapid response option to address emerging issues related to the health of the population.

verStmt.notes: Carleton University: February 23, 2015 - Fixed broken links, quality control.

citation.biblCit: Mueller, J. (2011). [DDI Codebook]. Toronto, Ontario: Map & Data Library, University of Toronto [producer]. Toronto, Ontario: Scholars Portal, Ontario Council of University Libraries [distributer].

serStmt.serInfo:
The Canadian Community Health Survey (CCHS) is a cross-sectional survey that collects information related to health status, health care utilization and health determinants for the Canadian population. The survey's objectives were to:
• support health surveillance programs by providing health data at the national, provincial and intra-provincial levels;
• provide a single data source for health research on small populations and rare characteristics;
• timely release of information easily accessible to a diverse community of users; and
• create a flexible survey instrument that includes a rapid response option to address emerging issues related to the health of the population.

citation.biblCit: Statistics Canada. 2011. Canadian Community Health Survey, 2010 [public-use microdata file]. Ottawa, Ontario: Statistics Canada. Health Statistics Division, Data Liberation Initiative [producer and distributor].

stdyInfo.abstract:
The Canadian Community Health Survey (CCHS) is a cross-sectional survey that collects information related to health status, health care utilization and health determinants for the Canadian population. It surveys a large sample of respondents and is designed to provide reliable estimates at the health region level. In 2007, major changes were made to the CCHS design. Data is now collected on an ongoing basis with annual releases, rather than every two years as was the case prior to 2007. The survey's objectives were also revised and are as follows:
  • support health surveillance programs by providing health data at the national, provincial and intra-provincial levels;
  • provide a single data source for health research on small populations and rare characteristics;
  • timely release of information easily accessible to a diverse community of users; and
  • create a flexible survey instrument that includes a rapid response option to address emerging issues related to the health of the population.

sumDscr.universe: The CCHS targets persons aged 12 years and older who are living in private dwellings in the ten provinces and three territories. Persons living on Indian Reserves or Crown lands, those residing in institutions, full-time members of the Canadian Forces and residents of certain remote regions are excluded from this survey. The CCHS covers approximately 98% of the Canadian population aged 12 and older.

useStmt.restrctn: The data is restricted to use by current students, faculty and staff of Ontario Council of University Libraries (OCUL) Member Libraries for academic research and teaching only.
useStmt.citReq: The publishing of analysis and results from research using any of the data products is permitted in research communications such as scholarly papers, journals and the like. The authors of these communications are required to cite Statistics Canada as the source of the data, and to indicate that the results or views expressed are those of the author/authorized user and are not those of Statistics Canada.

var.name: GEN_01

qstn.qstnLit: In general, would you say your health is: (excellent, very good, good, fair, or poor)?

var.universe: All respondents
var.notes: By health, we mean not only the absence of disease or injury but also physical, mental and social wellbeing.

var.name: GEN_02

qstn.qstnLit: Compared to one year ago, how would you say your health is now? Is it : (much better now than 1 year ago, somewhat better now than 1 year ago, about the same as 1 year ago, somewhat worse now, or much worse now than 1 year ago)?

var.universe: All respondents

var.name: GEN_02A2

var.universe: Females aged 18 and over
var.notes: Note 1: In processing, if a respondent answered MAM_037 = 1 (yes), the variable MAM_038 is given the value of 2 (no); if a respondent answered PAP_26M = 1 (have had a hysterectomy), the variable MAM_038 is given the value of 1 (yes). Note 2: The "Not Stated" category includes people who did the interview by proxy. The high number of "Not Stated" responses for 2007 resulted from an error in the application flow. Women aged 50 and over should have skipped only question HWT_Q1, but instead they also skipped MAM_Q038.

var.notes: Based on SFE_501, SFE_502, SFE_503, SFE_504, SFE_505, SFE_506. Scores on the index are based on a subset of items from the self-esteem Rosenberg scale (1969). var.name: MEXDEBF2
var.universe: Respondents who answered MEX_03 = (2, 7 or 8) or MEX_05 = (2, 7 or 8) or MEX_07 < 13 or MEX_07 = (97 or 98) or MEX_01 = (7 or 8)
var.notes: Based on MEX_03, MEX_06, MEX_07. This variable is an update of MEXDEBF. It includes more categories, covers the 6 month period in a single category, and takes into account conflicting information provided in MEX_06 and MEX_07. Respondents who had not given birth in the past 5 years or who were less than 15 years old or more than 55 years old are excluded from the population. Since the variable is used to measure only the final duration of exclusive breastfeeding, mothers who will breastfed and who had not yet added any other liquid or solid foods to the baby's feeds are also excluded.

var.notes: Based on DPS_02, DPS_05, DPS_06, DPS_08A, DPS_08B, DPS_10, DPS_11, DPS_12, DPS_13, DPS_16, DPS_17, DPS_18, DPS_19, DPS_21A, DPS_21B, DPS_23, DPS_24, DPS_25, DPS_26. Higher scores indicate higher level of depression. See documentation on derived variables.

var.name: DPSDPP

qstn.qstnLit: Depr. scale - predicted prob. - (D)

var.universe: Respondents with DODPS = 1
var.notes: Based on DPSDSF. A probability of caseness of 0 was assigned to respondents who denied the stem questions. See documentation on derived variables.

var.name: DPSDWK

qstn.qstnLit: No. of weeks felt depressed - (D)

var.universe: Respondents who answered DPS_05 = (1, 7 or 8) or DPS_06 = (1, 7 or 8) or DPS_09 = (1, 7 or 8) or DPS_11 = (1, 7 or 8) or DPS_12 = (1, 7 or 8) or DPS_13 = (1, 7 or 8) or DPS_07 = (1, 2, 7 or 8) or DPS_19 = (1, 7 or 8) or DPS_22 = (1, 7 or 8) or DPS_24 = (1, 7 or 8) or DPS_25 = (1, 7 or 8) or DPS_26 = (1, 7 or 8) or DPS_20 = (1, 2, 7 or 8) or one of DPS_02, DPS_03, DPS_04, DPS_10, DPS_16, DPS_17, DPS_18, DPS_23 = (7 or 8)
var.notes: Based on DPS_14, DPS_27. Respondents who did not report feeling sad, blue or depressed and who did not report having lost interest in most things are excluded from the calculation of this variable; or did not show any required signs of depression have been excluded from the population. See documentation on derived variables.

var.name: DPSDMT
var.labl: Mth last felt depr.- 2 wks in a row -(D)

qstn.qstnLit: Mth last felt depr.- 2 wks in a row -(D)

var.universe: Respondents who answered DPS_14 < 52 or DPS_27 < 52 or DPS_14 = (97 or 98) or DPS_27 = (97 or 98) or one of DPS_02, DPS_03, DPS_04, DPS_05, DPS_06, DPS_07, DPS_09, DPS_10, DPS_11, DPS_12, DPS_13, DPS_16, DPS_17, DPS_18, DPS_19, DPS_20, DPS_22, DPS_23, DPS_24, DPS_25, DPS_26 = (7 or 8)
var.notes: Based on DPS_14, DPS_15, DPS_27, DPS_28. The following respondents have been excluded from the population: respondents who did not report feeling sad, blue or depressed and who did not report having lost interest in most things; or respondents who did not show any required signs of depression; or respondents who have been depressed more than 51 weeks in the last past year; in the calculation of this variable. See documentation on derived variables.

var.name: DOSUI
var.universe: All respondents
var.notes: Questions for this module were not asked in proxy interviews. Proxy interviews were coded as "not stated", which mostly explains the higher proportion of this category compared to modules where proxy was allowed.

var.name: SUI_1

qstn.qstnLit: Have you ever seriously considered committing suicide or taking your own life?

var.universe: Respondents aged 15 and over with DOSUI = 1

var.name: SUI_2

qstn.qstnLit: Has this happened in the past 12 months?

var.universe: Respondents who answered SUI_1 = (1, 7 or 8)

var.name: DOSFR
var.universe: All respondents

var.name: SFRDPFS

qstn.qstnLit: Physical functioning scale - (D)

var.universe: Respondents with DOSFR = 1
var.notes: Based on SFR_03, SFR_04, SFR_05, SFR_06, SFR_07, SFR_08, SFR_09, SFR_10, SFR_11, SFR_12. A high score reflects increased physical function. See documentation on derived variables.

var.name: SFRDSFS

qstn.qstnLit: Social functioning scale - (D)

var.universe: Respondents with DOSFR = 1
var.notes: Based on SFR_20, SFR_32. A high score reflects increased social functioning. See documentation on derived variables.

var.name: SFRDPRF

qstn.qstnLit: Role functioning (physical) scale - (D)

var.universe: Respondents with DOSFR = 1
var.notes: Based on SFR_13, SFR_14, SFR_15, SFR_16. A high score reflects increased physical functioning (i.e., less limitation). See documentation on derived variables.

var.name: SFRDMRF

qstn.qstnLit: Role functioning (mental) scale - (D)

var.universe: Respondents with DOSFR = 1
var.notes: Based on SFR_17, SFR_18, SFR_19. A high score is consistent with a positive mental health. See documentation on derived variables.

var.name: SFRDGMH

qstn.qstnLit: General mental health scale - (D)

var.universe: Respondents with DOSFR = 1
var.notes: Based on SFR_24, SFR_25, SFR_26, SFR_28, SFR_30. The scale is transformed to facilitate comparisons across scales and reflect a relative position. See documentation on derived variables.

var.name: SFRDVTS

qstn.qstnLit: Vitality scale - (D)

var.universe: Respondents with DOSFR = 1
var.notes: Based on SFR_23, SFR_27, SFR_29, SFR_31. A high score is consistent with a positive level of energy. See documentation on derived variables.

var.name: SFRDBPS

qstn.qstnLit: Bodily pain scale - (D)

var.universe: Respondents with DOSFR = 1
var.notes: Based on SFR_21, SFR_22. A high score is consistent with a decreased level of pain. See documentation on derived variables.

var.name: SFRDGHP

qstn.qstnLit: General health perceptions scale - (D)

var.universe: Respondents with DOSFR = 1
var.notes: Based on SFR_01, SFR_33, SFR_34, SFR_35, SFR_36. A high score is consistent with a positive perception of one's general health status. See documentation on derived variables.

var.name: SFRDPCS

qstn.qstnLit: Summary measure of physical health - (D)

var.universe: Respondents with DOSFR = 1
var.notes: Based on SFRDPFS, SFRDSFS, SFRDPRF, SFRDMRF, SFRDGMH, SFRDVTS, SFRDBPS, SFRDGHP. See documentation on derived variables.

var.name: SFRDMCS

qstn.qstnLit: Summary measure of mental health - (D)

var.universe: Respondents with DOSFR = 1
var.notes: Based on SFRDPFS, SFRDSFS, SFRDPRF, SFRDMRF, SFRDGMH, SFRDVTS, SFRDBPS, SFRDGHP. See documentation on derived variables.

var.name: DOWTM

var.notes: Questions for this module were not asked in proxy interviews. Proxy interviews were coded as "not stated", which mostly explains the higher proportion of this category compared to modules where proxy was allowed.

var.universe: All respondents
var.notes: Based on SDCDCGT and SDC_41.

var.name: SDC_8

qstn.qstnLit: Are you currently attending a school, college or university?

var.universe: DHH_AGE > 15 or PMKProxy = 1
var.notes: For educational attainment variables, see EDU_1 - EDUDR10. Beginning in 2010, the "Not Stated" category includes respondents for whom a person most knowledgeable about the household could not be identified (PMKProxy = 2)

var.name: SDC_9

qstn.qstnLit: Are you enrolled as a full-time student or a part-time student?

var.universe: Respondents who answered SDC_8 = (1, 7 or 8) and (DHH_AGE > 15 or PMKProxy = 1)
var.notes: For educational attainment variables, see EDU_1 - EDUDR10. Beginning in 2010, the "Not Stated" category includes respondents for whom a person most knowledgeable about the household could not be identified (PMKProxy = 2)

var.notes: Based on EDUDR04 for each member of the household. See documentation on derived variables. Beginning in 2010, the "Not Stated" category includes respondents for whom a person most knowledgeable about the household could not be identified (PMKProxy = 2)

var.name: EDUDR04
var.universe: (DHHDHSZ = 1 and DHH_AGE >= 14) or DHH_AGE > 15 or PMKPROXY = 1
var.notes: Based on EDU_1, EDU_2, EDU_3, EDU_4. See documentation on derived variables. Beginning in 2010, the "Not Stated" category includes respondents for whom a person most knowledgeable about the household could not be identified (PMKProxy = 2)

var.name: DOFSC
var.universe: All respondents

var.name: FSC_010

qstn.qstnLit: Which of the following statements best describes the food eaten in your household in the past 12 months? Would you say: (you always had enough of the kinds of food you wanted to eat, ..., or often you didn't have enough to eat)?

var.universe: DOFSC = 1 and (DHH_AGE >15 or PMKProxy = 1)
var.notes: Beginning in 2010, the "Not Stated" category includes respondents for whom a person most knowledgeable about the household could not be identified (PMKProxy = 2)

var.name: FSC_020
var.labl: Worried food would run out - 12 mo

qstn.qstnLit: You and other household members worried that food would run out before you got money to buy more. Was that often true, sometimes true, or never true in the past 12 months?

var.universe: DOFSC = 1 and (DHH_AGE >15 or PMKProxy = 1)
var.notes: Beginning in 2010, the "Not Stated" category includes respondents for whom a person most knowledgeable about the household could not be identified (PMKProxy = 2)

var.name: FSC_030
var.labl: No food and no money for more - 12 mo

qstn.qstnLit: The food that you and other household members bought just didn't last, and there wasn't any money to get more. Was that often true, sometimes true, or never true in the past 12 months?

var.universe: DOFSC = 1 and (DHH_AGE >15 or PMKProxy = 1)
var.notes: Beginning in 2010, the "Not Stated" category includes respondents for whom a person most knowledgeable about the household could not be identified (PMKProxy = 2)

var.name: FSC_040
var.labl: Could not afford balanced meals - 12 mo

qstn.qstnLit: You and other household members couldn't afford to eat balanced meals. In the past 12 months was that often true, sometimes true, or never true?

var.universe: DOFSC = 1 and (DHH_AGE >15 or PMKProxy = 1)
var.notes: Beginning in 2010, the "Not Stated" category includes respondents for whom a person most knowledgeable about the household could not be identified (PMKProxy = 2)

var.name: FSC_050
var.labl: Few kinds low-cost food for kids -12 mo

qstn.qstnLit: You or other adults in your household relied on only a few kinds of low-cost food to feed the children because you were running out of money to buy food. Was that often true, sometimes true, or never true in the past 12 months?

var.universe: Respondents with (DHHDOKD + DHHDYKD) > 0 and (DHH_AGE > 15 or PMKProxy = 1)
var.notes: Beginning in 2010, the "Not Stated" category includes respondents for whom a person most knowledgeable about the household could not be identified (PMKProxy = 2)

var.name: FSC_060
var.labl: Couldn't feed child. bal. meal - 12 mo

qstn.qstnLit: You or other adults in your household couldn't feed the children a balanced meal, because you couldn't afford it. Was that often true, sometimes true, or never true in the past 12 months?

var.universe: Respondents with (DHHDOKD + DHHDYKD) > 0 and (DHH_AGE > 15 or PMKProxy = 1)
var.notes: Beginning in 2010, the "Not Stated" category includes respondents for whom a person most knowledgeable about the household could not be identified (PMKProxy = 2)

var.name: FSC_070
var.labl: Children were not eating enough - 12 mo

qstn.qstnLit: The children were not eating enough because you or other adults in your household just couldn't afford enough food. Was that often, sometimes, or never true in the past 12 months?

var.universe: Respondents with (DHHDOKD + DHHDYKD) > 0, who answered ((FSC_020 or FSC_030 or FSC_040 or FSC_050 or FSC_060) = (1,2, 7 or 8) or (FSC_010 = (3, 4, 7 or 8) and (DHH_AGE > 15 or PMKProxy = 1)
var.notes: Beginning in 2010, the "Not Stated" category includes respondents for whom a person most knowledgeable about the household could not be identified (PMKProxy = 2)

var.name: FSC_080
var.labl: Adults cut or skipped meals - 12 mo

qstn.qstnLit: In the past 12 months, did you or other adults in your household ever cut the size of your meals or skip meals because there wasn't enough money for food?

var.universe: Respondents who answered ((FSC_020 or FSC_030 or FSC_040 or FSC_050 or FSC_060) = (1, 2, 7 or 8)) or (FSC_010 = (3, 4, 7 or 8)) and (DHH_AGE > 15 or PMKProxy = 1)
var.notes: Beginning in 2010, the "Not Stated" category includes respondents for whom a person most knowledgeable about the household could not be identified (PMKProxy = 2)

var.name: FSC_081

qstn.qstnLit: How often did this happen---almost every month, some months but not every month, or in only 1 or 2 months?

var.universe: Respondents who answered FSC_080 = (1, 7 or 8) or FSC_010 = (7 or 8) or (all of (FSC_020, FSC_030, FSC_040) = (3, 7 or 8) and FSC_010 = (1 or 2) and (DHHDOKD+DHHDYKD = 0 or FSC_050 = (3, 7 or 8) and FSC_060 = (3, 7 or 8)) and at least one of (FSC_020, FSC_030, FSC_040, FSC_050, FSC_060) = (7 or 8)) and (DHH_AGE > 15 or PMKProxy = 1)
var.notes: Beginning in 2010, the "Not Stated" category includes respondents for whom a person most knowledgeable about the household could not be identified (PMKProxy = 2)

var.name: FSC_090
var.labl: Ate less than felt should - 12 mo

qstn.qstnLit: In the past 12 months, did you (personally) ever eat less than you felt you should because there wasn't enough money to buy food?

var.universe: Respondents who answered ((FSC_020 or FSC_030 or FSC_040 or FSC_050 or FSC_060) = (1, 2, 7 or 8)) or FSC_010 = (3, 4, 7 or 8) and (DHH_AGE > 15 or PMKProxy = 1)
var.notes: Beginning in 2010, the "Not Stated" category includes respondents for whom a person most knowledgeable about the household could not be identified (PMKProxy = 2)

var.name: FSC_100
var.labl: Was hungry but could not eat - 12 mo

qstn.qstnLit: In the past 12 months, were you (personally) ever hungry but didn't eat because you couldn't afford enough food?

var.universe: Respondents who answered ((FSC_020 or FSC_030 or FSC_040 or FSC_050 or FSC_060) = (1, 2, 7 or 8)) or FSC_010 = (1, 2, 7or 8) and (DHH_AGE > 15 or PMKProxy = 1)
var.notes: Beginning in 2010, the "Not Stated" category includes respondents for whom a person most knowledgeable about the household could not be identified (PMKProxy = 2)

var.name: FSC_110
var.labl: Lost weight no money for food- 12 mo

qstn.qstnLit: In the past 12 months, did you (personally) lose weight because you didn't have enough money for food?

var.universe: Respondents who answered (((FSC_020 or FSC_030 or FSC_040 or FSC_050 or FSC_060) = (1, 2, 7 or 8)) or FSC_010 = (3, 4, 7 or 8)) and (DHH_AGE > 15 or PMKProxy = 1)
var.notes: Beginning in 2010, the "Not Stated" category includes respondents for whom a person most knowledgeable about the household could not be identified (PMKProxy = 2)

var.universe: Respondents who answered (FSC_070 = (1, 2, 7 or 8)) or at least one of (FSC_080, FSC_090, FSC_100, FSC_110) = (1, 7 or 8) or FSC_010 = (7 or 8) or (all of (FSC_020, FSC_030, FSC_040) = (3, 7 or 8) and FSC_010 = (1 or 2) and (DHHDOKD+DHHDYKD = 0 or FSC_050 = (3, 7 or 8) and FSC_060 = (3, 7 or 8)) and at least one of (FSC_020, FSC_030, FSC_040, FSC_050, FSC_060) = (7 or 8)) and (DHH_AGE > 15 or PMKProxy = 1)

var.universe: Respondents who answ. FSC_120 = (1, 7 or 8) or ((DHHDOKD+DHHDYKD)=0 or FSC_70=(3, 7 or 8) and all of (FSC_080, FSC_090, FSC_100, FSC_110)=(2, 7 or 8) and at least one of (FSC_070, FSC_080, FSC_090, FSC_100, FSC_110) = (7 or 8) or FSC_010 = (7 or 8) or (all of (FSC_020, FSC_030, FSC_040) = (3, 7 or 8) and FSC_010 = (1 or 2) and (DHHDOKD+DHHDYKD = 0 or FSC_050 = (3, 7 or 8) and FSC_060 = (3, 7 or 8)) and at least one of (FSC_020, FSC_030, FSC_040, FSC_050, FSC_060) = (7 or 8)) and (DHH_AGE>15 or PMKProxy=1)
var.notes: Beginning in 2010, the "Not Stated" category includes respondents for whom a person most knowledgeable about the household could not be identified (PMKProxy = 2)
